GeoÔÉÅ

class pyrit.geometry.Geo(name: str, origin_x: float = 0, origin_y: float = 0, origin_z: float = 0, anchor: Union[BasicAnchor, Tuple[float]] = BasicAnchor.SOUTH_WEST)ÔÉÅ

Bases: ABC

Abstract class Geo.

Collection of implementations for gmsh. Every Geo has a name, an own origin and a list of other Geo objects.

Constructor

Parameters

  • name (str) ‚Äì Name of the Geo

  • origin_x (float, optional) ‚Äì The x-coordinate of the origin. Default 0

  • origin_y (float, optional) ‚Äì The y-coordinate of the origin. Default 0

  • origin_z (float, optional) ‚Äì The z-coordinate of the origin. Default 0

Methods

add_to_gmsh

Adds the Entities of the Geo to gmsh.

determine_coordinates

Computes the coordinates of an anchor.

get_origin

Returns an array with the x, y and z coordinate of the origin.

scale

Scale in all directions by a factor.

set_origin

Set all coordinates of the origin at one.

translate

Translate the Geo.

Attributes

center

Coordinates of the center anchor

Coordinates of the east anchor

Coordinates of the north anchor

Coordinates of the north_east anchor

Coordinates of the north-west anchor

Coordinates of the south anchor

Coordinates of the south-east anchor

Coordinates of the south-west anchor

Coordinates of the west anchor
AnchorÔÉÅ

alias of BasicAnchor

abstract scale(scale: float) → NoReturnÔÉÅ

Scale in all directions by a factor.

Parameters

scale (float) ‚Äì The factor to scale.

abstract add_to_gmsh() → NoReturnÔÉÅ

Adds the Entities of the Geo to gmsh.

When this method is called, gmsh needs to be initialized. So at least

gmsh.initialize(sys.argv)

has to be called beforehand. However, it is recommended to use the context manager Geometry from the class Geometry.

abstract determine_coordinates(anchor: Union[BasicAnchor, Tuple[float]]) → ndarrayÔÉÅ

Computes the coordinates of an anchor.

Parameters

anchor (Union[Anchor, Tuple[float]]) ‚Äì An anchor or tuple of the relative coordinates. (0,0) is the south-west corner (1,1) is the north-east corner.

Returns

coordinates ‚Äì The coordinates of the anchor.

Return type

np.ndarray

translate(dx: float, dy: float, dz: float) → NoReturnÔÉÅ

Translate the Geo.

Parameters

  • dx (float) ‚Äì Translation in x direction.

  • dy (float) ‚Äì Translation in y direction.

  • dz (float) ‚Äì Translation in z direction.

set_origin(origin_x: float, origin_y: float, origin_z: float) → NoReturnÔÉÅ

Set all coordinates of the origin at one.

Parameters

  • origin_x (float) ‚Äì The x-coordinate of the origin.

  • origin_y (float) ‚Äì The y-coordinate of the origin.

  • origin_z (float) ‚Äì The z-coordinate of the origin.

get_origin() → ndarrayÔÉÅ

Returns an array with the x, y and z coordinate of the origin.

Returns

origin ‚Äì (3,) array with x, y and z coordinate of the origin.

Return type
